turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Betty, I thought this would be the best way. You know, throw you into it...

turns.speaker: LYLA
turns.text: What the hell's going on?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: If you need a minute, that's okay. But I thought you'd want to --

turns.speaker: LYLA
turns.text: Is there a problem, George?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: No! No problem, there is no...  What is the problem? Just do that... thing... you do! Come on! You drove me nuts with this for three days, now do it!

turns.speaker: LYLA
turns.text: All right, everybody! That's ten minutes!

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: No! Let me try this!

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Let me try this, goddamnit! SHE'S BEEN DOING IT ALL WEEK, SHE CAN DO IT NOW!

turns.speaker: LYLA
turns.text: I SAID FORGET IT!

turns.speaker: LYLA
turns.text: This story is beyond belief, which is perfect for us. It's free advertising and it's gonna run for months.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I don't think she can do it. You saw what happened.

turns.speaker: LYLA
turns.text: You fucked it up. Who wouldn't freeze in those circumstances? And I don't care what her problems are. She wouldn't be the first one in that cast with problems. We have nothing to lose by making her an offer.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: What about me? Don't you wanna know how I feel about it? I'm the one who...

turns.speaker: LYLA
turns.text: Why would I give a shit how you feel. And I got news for you. I loved your 'icy water' idea the other day... I'm toying with the idea of killing David Ravell off in a boating accident.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: That's not a bad idea. How many episodes before he comes back?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Jesus, don't do that! If it gets around that you fired me, I'll never land a pilot.

turns.speaker: LYLA
turns.text: Then do as you're told. Get her back.

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: ...what kinda car's Jasmine drive?

turns.speaker: GUARD
turns.text: Ahh, Mercedes, I think. Black.

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: Yeah? The sport utility?

turns.speaker: GUARD
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: Damn, that's sweet...  She really that good-looking in person?

turns.speaker: GUARD
turns.text: Better.

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: Oh fuck...

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: Hey, can you sneak me on the lot?

turns.speaker: GUARD
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: JERROLD
turns.text: And she always had such spirit! But, after her mother died...

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: Would you say she was ambitious?

turns.speaker: JERROLD
turns.text: Oh, there's no tellin' what that girl could've accomplished, and she never had it easy. Never really had a childhood... caring for her father, going to school.

turns.speaker: JERROLD
turns.text: You've got to be missing a piece of your soul to kill someone. That's not our Betty...

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: ...why do you think you have to be missing a piece of your soul to kill somebody?

turns.speaker: JERROLD
turns.text: Because it ain't natural, young man.

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: What are you talking about? Killing's totally natural. It's dying that isn't natural...

turns.speaker: JOYCE
turns.text: You're wastin' your time, Roy.

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: Look Joyce, I need your key to the files, not advice, okay? This is a complex case.

turns.speaker: JOYCE
turns.text: Nothin' complex about it. Del's dead, Betty's gone. She's probably dead, too.

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: You'd like that wouldn't you? You've hated Betty since you were in Pep Squad together...

turns.speaker: JOYCE
turns.text: No... before that.

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: Ahh, I hate this town! Places like this just make you small...  I should have never come back here after college.

turns.speaker: JOYCE
turns.text: Blah -- blah -- blah... Hurry up, will ya, I got a date tonight...

turns.speaker: JOYCE
turns.text: I don't know what you think you'll find, anyway.

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: Names, a phone number, something...  Listen, Ballard told me that the guy who brought the missing car down from Detroit was murdered, but do you see him doing anything about it? If Ballard wasn't such a stubborn ass, I wouldn't have to be breaking in here...

turns.speaker: JOYCE
turns.text: What did you say?

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: The driver was killed. I think there's a connection --

turns.speaker: JOYCE
turns.text: No, about... Are you talking about Duane Cooley?

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: Yeah. Why, you know him?

turns.speaker: JOYCE
turns.text: Know him? We were gonna get married! He was gonna leave his wife for me! Fuck!!...

turns.speaker: MERCEDES
turns.text: What do you think my father would do if I told him I didn't want to be a lawyer anymore?

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: Probably the same thing my mom would do if I got engaged... have a heart attack.

turns.speaker: MERCEDES
turns.text: So how's it going with your new roomie? What's her name?

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: Betty. It's O.K. except I'm worn out. We spent all weekend looking for her doctor-boy. How can a big time heart guy leave no trace of himself?

turns.speaker: MERCEDES
turns.text: So tell her to settle for the old one in Orange County.

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: She's gonna have to 'cause I'm out of ideas.

turns.speaker: MERCEDES
turns.text: Maybe we're suing him for malpractice. What's his name again?

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: David Ravell.

turns.speaker: MERCEDES
turns.text: God, that sounds so familiar. Ravell, Ravell... where's he out of?

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: I'm not sure now. She said he used to be over at Loma Vista. I never heard of it.

turns.speaker: MERCEDES
turns.text: Loma Vista?  You mean like the guy on "A Reason to Love?"

turns.speaker: MERCEDES
turns.text: Hey... Is Betty still trying to find that soap opera guy?

turns.speaker: ROSA
turns.text: Oh, yeah... Man, I'd love to find that actor just to see the look on her face, watch her bubble burst in mid-air.

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: SHUT UP! Shut the fuck up, both of you, before I kill you!

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: I'm the one who watched the show... I was...

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: Did Chloe crack?

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: Totally. She came apart like a house of cards. They dropped the charges...

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: Goddamn... how 'bout Jasmine?

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: She's a lesbian.

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: You lie, motherfucker...

turns.speaker: ROY
turns.text: I swear to God!

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: Mrs. Rogers? I'm Dwight Campbell, with Neighborly Life Insurance. I'm looking for Betty Sizemore.

turns.speaker: SUE ANN
turns.text: I wish I could help you, but I can't.

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: Aren't they precious?  Ma'am, she has a substantial death benefit coming to her from the tragic loss of her husband. Does she have any relatives in the area?

turns.speaker: SUE ANN
turns.text: No.  Well, her grandparents are down in Oklahoma, but that's it...

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: I see. And are you in touch with Mrs. Sizemore?

turns.speaker: SUE ANN
turns.text: No. But I'm taping her show every day so she can watch it when she comes back.

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: Her show?

turns.speaker: SUE ANN
turns.text: "A Reason to Love."

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: I see.  Did Chloe testify?

turns.speaker: SUE ANN
turns.text: I don't think she will. She's a slut, but I just don't think she's that mean. Jasmine'll bring her around...

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: Jasmine... Do you have yesterday's show on tape, by any chance?

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: SUE ANN
turns.text: Mr. Campbell?

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: SUE ANN
turns.text: Is this Neighborly Life Insurance?

turns.speaker: WESLEY
turns.text: Oh, umm, yes, this is Dwight Campbell.

turns.speaker: SUE ANN
turns.text: It's Sue Ann Rogers, Betty Sizemore's friend? I heard from her.

turns.speaker: BIG DAN
turns.text: I flatter myself that such is the case; in my line of work it's plumb necessary. The one thing you don't want is air in the conversation.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Once again we find ourselves in agreement.  What kind of work do you do, Big Dan?

turns.speaker: BIG DAN
turns.text: Sales, Mr. McGill, sales! And what do I sell? The Truth! Ever' blessed word of it, from Genesee on down to Revelations! That's right, the word of God, which let me add there is damn good money in during these days of woe and want! Folks're lookin' for answers and Big Dan Teague sells the only book that's got 'em! What do you do - you and your tongue-tied friend?

turns.speaker: BIG DAN
turns.text: Thankee boys for throwin' in that fricasee. I'm a man a large appetite and even with lunch under my belt I was feeling a mite peckish.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Our pleasure, Big Dan.

turns.speaker: BIG DAN
turns.text: And thank you as well for that conversational hiatus; I generally refrain from speech while engaged in gustation. There are those who attempt both at the same time but I find it course and vulgar. Now where were we?

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: I like to think that I'm a pretty astute observer of the human scene.

turns.speaker: BIG DAN
turns.text: No doubt, brother - I figured as much back there in the restaurant. That's why I invited you out here for this advanced tutorial.

turns.speaker: COOLEY
turns.text: End of the road, boys. It's had its twists and turns -

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Waitaminute -

turns.speaker: COOLEY
turns.text: - but now it deposits you here.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Waitaminute -

turns.speaker: COOLEY
turns.text: You have eluded fate - and eluded me - for the last time. Tie their hands, boys.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: You can't do this -

turns.speaker: COOLEY
turns.text: Didn't know you'd be bringin' a friend.  Well, he'll have to wait his turn -

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Hang on there -

turns.speaker: COOLEY
turns.text: - and share one of your graves.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: You can't do this - we just been pardoned!  By the Governer himself!

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: It ain't the law!

turns.speaker: COOLEY
turns.text: The law. Well the law is a human institution.

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: 'N I'm Delmar O'Donnell.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: How ya been, Wash? Been what, twelve, thirteen year'n?

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: We ain't gonna make it walkin'.

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: Gopher, Everett?

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: You got light fingers, Everett. Gopher?

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: You mis'able little sneak thief...

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: That's right!

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: That's right! We ain't really Negroes!

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: All except fer our a-cump-uh-nust!

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: Why don't we bed down out here tonight?

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Yeah, it stinks in that ol' barn.

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: Visit those foreclosin' sonofaguns down at the Indianola Savings and Loan and slap that cash down on the barrelhead and buy back the family farm. Hell, you ain't no kind of man if you ain't got land.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: What about you, Everett? What'd you have in mind when you stoled it in the first place?

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: ...Pete?

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Do not seek the treasure!

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: We didn't abandon you, Pete, we just thought you was a toad.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: No, they never did turn me into a toad.

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: Well that was our mistake then. And then we was beat up by a bible salesman and banished from Woolworth's. I don't know if it's the one branch or all of 'em.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Well I - I ain't had it easy either, boys.  Uh, frankly, I - well I spilled my guts about the treasure.

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: Huh?!

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Awful sorry I betrayed you fellas; must be my Hogwallop blood.

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: I'm sorry we got you into this, Tommy.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Good Lord, what do we do?

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: How'd he know about the treasure?

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Don't know, Delmar-though the blind are reputed to possess sensitivities compensatin' for their lack of sight, even to the point of developing para- normal psychic powers. Now clearly, seein' the future would fall neatly into that ka-taggery. It's not so surprising, then, if an organism deprived of earthly vision-

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: What do we do now, Everett?

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Fire! I hate fire!

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: NOW HOLD ON, BOYS-AINTCHA EVER HEARD OF A NEGOTIATION? MAYBE WE CAN TALK THIS THING OUT!

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: Yeah, let's negotiate 'em, Everett.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: ...but try getting a decent hair jelly.

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: Gopher, Everett?

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: And no transmission belt for two weeks neither.

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: Well that's it boys, I been redeemed! The preacher warshed away all my sins and transgressions. It's the straight-and-narrow from here on out and heaven everlasting's my reward!

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Delmar what the hell are you talking about? - We got bigger fish to fry-

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: Preacher said my sins are warshed away, including that Piggly Wiggly I knocked over in Yazoo!

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: I thought you said you were innocent a those charges.

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: Well I was lyin' - and I'm proud to say that that sin's been warshed away too!  Neither God nor man's got nothin' on me now! Come on in, boys, the water's fine!

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: But there were witnesses, saw us redeemed!

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: That's not the issue, Delmar. Even if it did put you square with the Lord, the State of Mississippi is more hardnosed.

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: You should a joined us, Everett. It couldn't a hurt none.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Baptism. You two are just dumber'n a bag of hammers. Well, I guess you're my cross to bear-

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: Pull over, Everett - let's give that colored boy a lift.

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: This ain't no laughin' matter, Everett.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: What'd the devil give you for your soul, Tommy?

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: Five... hunnert... thousand... each.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Four hundred, Delmar.

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: Izzat right?

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: What're you gonna do with your share of the treasure, Pete?

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: Damn! We gotta skedaddle!

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: I left my pomade in that car! Maybe I can creep up!

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: Don't be a fool, Everett, we gotta R- U-N-O-F-F-T, but pronto!

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Where's Tommy?

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: Yeah, look at me.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Now you may call it an unreasoning optimism. You may call it obtuse. But the plain fact is we still have... close to... close to...

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: Now wuddya suppose is eatin' George?

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Well ya know, Delmar, they say that with a thrill-seekin' personality, what goes up must come down. Top of the world one minute, haunted by megrims the next. Yep, it's like our friend George is a alley cat and his own damn humors're swingin' him by the tail. But don't worry, Delmar; he'll be back on top again. I don't think we've heard the last of George Nelson.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Whuhh...

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: Oh sweet Lord, Everett, looka this!

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: What on earth is goin' on here! What's got into you, Delmar!

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: Caintcha see it Everett! Them sigh- reens did this to Pete! They loved him up an' turned him into a horney- toad!

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: ...I'm not sure that's Pete.

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: Course it's Pete! Look at 'im!

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: You can't display a toad in a fine restaurant like this! Why, the good folks here'd go right off their feed!

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: I just don't think it's right, keepin' him under wraps like we's ashamed of him.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Well if that is Pete I am ashamed of him.  The way I see it he got what he deserved - fornicating with some whore a Babylon.  These things-

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: Uh, we uh-

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: We're adventurers, sir, currently pursuin' a certain opportunity but open to others as well.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Pete have a brother?

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: Not that I'm aware.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Deceitful! Two-faced! She-Woman! Never trust a female, Delmar! Remember that one simple precept and your time with me will not have been ill spent!

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: Okay, Everett.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Hit by a train! Truth means nothin' to Woman, Delmar. Triumph a the subjective!  You ever been with a woman?

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: Well, uh, I - I gotta get the family farm back before I can start thinkin' about that.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Well that's right! If then! Believe me, Delmar, Woman is the most fiendish instrument of torture ever devised to bedevil the days a man!

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: Everett, I never figured you for a paterfamilias.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Oh-ho-ho yes, I've spread my seed. And you see what it, uh... what it's earned me... Now what in the...

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: So - where's all the money from your armored-car job?

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: I never knocked over any armored- car. I was sent up for practicing law without a license.

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: Huh. I guess they'll tack on fifty years for me too.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Boys, we was chained together. I hadda tell ya somethin'. Bustin' out alone was not a option!

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: It's Tommy! They got Tommy!

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: Oh my God!

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: 'N turned into a frog -

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: He was never turned into a frog!

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Scuse me... scuse me... we're the next act...

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: Everett, my beard itches.

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: What sat mean exactly, Everett?

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Well, you'n me'n Pete'n Tommy are gonna be the power behind the throne so to speak.

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: Oh, okay.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: I guess Vernon T. Waldrip is gonna be goin' on relief. Maybe I'll be able to throw a little patronage his way, get the man a job diggin' ditches or rounding up stray dogs.

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: Is the marriage off then, Miz Wharvey?

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: We'll go fetch it with ya, Everett.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Honey, it's just - Shutup, Delmar - it's just -

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: A miracle! It was a miracle!

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Aw, don't be ignorant, Delmar. I told you they was gonna flood this valley.

turns.speaker: DELMAR
turns.text: That ain't it!

turns.speaker: PAPPY
turns.text: We ain't one-at-a-timin' here, we mass communicatin'!

turns.speaker: ECKARD
turns.text: Oh, yes, assa parful new force.

turns.speaker: PAPPY
turns.text: I'm just makin' a point, you stupid sonofabitch!

turns.speaker: ECKARD
turns.text: Okay, Pappy.

turns.speaker: PAPPY
turns.text: Y'ignorant slope-shouldered sack a guts!  Why we'd look like a buncha satchel-ass Johnnie-Come-Latelies braggin' on our own midget! Don't matter how stumpy! And that's the goddamn problem right there - people think this Stokes got fresh ideas, he's oh coorant and we the past.

turns.speaker: ECKARD
turns.text: Problem a p'seption.

turns.speaker: PAPPY
turns.text: I'm sayin' we har this man away.

turns.speaker: ECKARD
turns.text: Assa good idea, Pappy.

turns.speaker: PAPPY
turns.text: What's his name again?

turns.speaker: ECKARD
turns.text: Campaign manager? Waldrip.

turns.speaker: PAPPY
turns.text: You don't know where his goddamn folks from; you speakin' outcha asshole.

turns.speaker: ECKARD
turns.text: Well now Pappy I wouldn't put it that strong...

turns.speaker: ECKARD
turns.text: Finest governor we've ever had in M'sippi.

turns.speaker: SPIVEY
turns.text: In any state.

turns.speaker: ECKARD
turns.text: Oh Lord yes, any parish'r precinct; I was makin' the larger point.

turns.speaker: ECKARD
turns.text: Them straw polls is ugly.

turns.speaker: SPIVEY
turns.text: Stokes is pullin' ah pants down.

turns.speaker: ECKARD
turns.text: Gonna pluck us off the tit.

turns.speaker: SPIVEY
turns.text: Pappy gonna be sittin' there pants down and Stokes at the table soppin' up the gravy.

turns.speaker: ECKARD
turns.text: Latch right on to that tit.

turns.speaker: SPIVEY
turns.text: Wipin' little circles with his bread.

turns.speaker: ECKARD
turns.text: Suckin' away.

turns.speaker: SPIVEY
turns.text: Well, it's a well-run campaign, midget'n broom'n whatnot.

turns.speaker: ECKARD
turns.text: Devil his due.

turns.speaker: SPIVEY
turns.text: Helluva awgazation.

turns.speaker: SPIVEY
turns.text: Ass right.

turns.speaker: ECKARD
turns.text: Reason why he's pullin' ah pants down.

turns.speaker: SPIVEY
turns.text: Gonna paddle ah little bee-hind.

turns.speaker: ECKARD
turns.text: Ain't gonna paddle it; he's gonna kick it real hard.

turns.speaker: SPIVEY
turns.text: No, I believe he's a-gonna paddle it.

turns.speaker: ECKARD
turns.text: Well now, I don't believe assa property scription.

turns.speaker: SPIVEY
turns.text: Well, that's how I characterize it.

turns.speaker: ECKARD
turns.text: Well, I believe it's mawva kickin' sichation.

turns.speaker: SPIVEY
turns.text: Pullin' ah pants down...

turns.speaker: ECKARD
turns.text: Wipin' little circles with his bread...

turns.speaker: SPIVEY
turns.text: Helluva idea.

turns.speaker: ECKARD
turns.text: Cain't beat 'em, join 'em.

turns.speaker: SPIVEY
turns.text: Have him join us, run our campaign 'stead a that pencil-neck's.

turns.speaker: ECKARD
turns.text: Enticements a power, wealth, settera.

turns.speaker: SPIVEY
turns.text: No one says no to Pappy O'Daniel.

turns.speaker: ECKARD
turns.text: Oh gracious no. Not with his blandishments.

turns.speaker: SPIVEY
turns.text: Powas p'suasion.

turns.speaker: SPIVEY
turns.text: Vernon Waldrip.

turns.speaker: ECKARD
turns.text: Vernon T. Waldrip.

turns.speaker: ECKARD
turns.text: Pappy O'Daniel be laughing' then.

turns.speaker: SPIVEY
turns.text: Not out the other side his face, though.

turns.speaker: ECKARD
turns.text: Oh no, no, just the reg'la side -

turns.speaker: PENNY
turns.text: That ain't your daddy, Alvinelle. Your daddy was hit by a train.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Now Penny, stop that!

turns.speaker: PENNY
turns.text: No - you stop it! Vernon here's got a job. Vernon's got prospects. He's bona fide! What're you?

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: I'll tell you what I am - I'm the paterfamilias! You can't marry him!

turns.speaker: PENNY
turns.text: I can and I am and I will - tomorrow! I gotta think about the little Wharvey gals! They look to me for answers! Vernon can s'port 'em and buy 'em lessons on the clarinet! The only good thing you ever did for the gals was get his by that train!

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: ...Why you... lyin,... unconstant... succubus!

turns.speaker: PENNY
turns.text: McGill. No, the marriage'll take place as planned.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Just a little change of cast. Me and the little lady are gonna pick up the pieces'n retie the knot, mixaphorically speakin'. You boys're invited, of course. Hell, you're best men! Already got the rings.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Where's your ring, honey?

turns.speaker: PENNY
turns.text: I ain't worn it since our divorce came through. It must still be in the rolltop in the old cabin. Never thought I'd need it; Vernon bought one encrusted with jewels.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Hell, now's the time to buy it off him cheap.

turns.speaker: PENNY
turns.text: We ain't gettin' married with his ring!  You said you'd changed!

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Aw, honey, our ring is just a old pewter thing -

turns.speaker: PENNY
turns.text: Ain't gonna be no weddin'.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: It's just a symbol, honey -

turns.speaker: PENNY
turns.text: No weddin'.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: All's well that ends well, as the poet says.

turns.speaker: PENNY
turns.text: That's right, honey.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: But I don't mind telling you, I'm awful pleased my adventuring days is at an end...

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: ...Time for this old boy to enjoy some repose.

turns.speaker: PENNY
turns.text: That's good, honey.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: And you were right about that ring. Any other weddin' band would not do. But this-here was foreordained, honey; fate was a-smilin' on me, and ya have to have confidence -

turns.speaker: PENNY
turns.text: That's not my ring.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: - in the gods - Huh?

turns.speaker: PENNY
turns.text: That's not my ring.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Not your...

turns.speaker: PENNY
turns.text: That's one of Aunt Hurlene's.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: You said it was in the rolltop desk!

turns.speaker: PENNY
turns.text: I said I thought it was in the rolltop desk.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: You said -

turns.speaker: PENNY
turns.text: Or, it might a been under the mattress.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: You -

turns.speaker: PENNY
turns.text: Or in my chiffonier. I don't know.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Well, I'm sorry honey -

turns.speaker: PENNY
turns.text: Well, we need that ring.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Well now honey, that ring is at the bottom of a pretty durned big lake.

turns.speaker: PENNY
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: A 9,000-hectacre lake, honey.

turns.speaker: PENNY
turns.text: I don't care if it's ninety thousand.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Yes, but honey -

turns.speaker: PENNY
turns.text: That wasn't my doing...

turns.speaker: PENNY
turns.text: I counted to three, honey.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Well sure, honey, but...

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Wait a minute! Who elected you leader a this outfit?

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Well, Pete, I just figured it should be the one with capacity for abstract thought. But if that ain't the consensus view, hell, let's put her to a vote!

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Suits me! I'm votin' for yours truly!

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Well I'm votin' for yours truly too!

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Pete's cousin turned us in for the bounty!

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: The hell you say! Wash is kin!

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: YOU LOUSY YELLA-BELLIED LOW-DOWN SKUNKS-

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Now hold on, Pete, we gotta speak with one voice here - CAREFUL WITH THAT FIRE NOW, BOYS!

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Huh?! They dam that river on the 21st.  Today's the 17th!

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Don't I know it.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: We got but four days to get to that treasure! After that, it'll be at the bottom of a lake!

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: How's this a plan? How're we gonna get a car?

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Sell that. I figured it could only have painful associations for Wash.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: To Washington Bartholomew Hogwallop. From his loving Cora. Ay-More Fie- dellis.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: It was in his bureau.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Who was fixing to betray us!

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: You didn't know that at the time!

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: So I borrowed it till I did know!

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: That don't make no sense!

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Pete, it's a fool looks for logic in the chambers of the human heart. What the hell's that singing?

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Well, I'll be a sonofabitch. Delmar's been saved!

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Pete, don't be ignorant-

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: The preacher said it absolved us.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: For him, not for the law! I'm surprised at you, Pete. Hell, I gave you credit for more brains than Delmar.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Hell, at least it woulda washed away the stink of that pomade.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Join you two ignorant fools in a ridiculous superstition? Thank you anyway.  And I like the smell of my hair treatment - the pleasing odor is half the point.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: A million dollars.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Million point two.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: An' all my meals for free...

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: What about you, Delmar? What're you gonna do with your share a that dough?

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Me? Oh, I didn't have no plan. Still don't, really.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Well that hardly sounds like you...

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: The hell it ain't square one! Ain't no one gonna pick up three filthy unshaved hitchhikers, and one of 'em a know-it-all that can't keep his trap shut!

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Pete, the personal rancor reflected in that remark I don't intend to dignify with comment, but I would like to address your general attitude of hopeless negativism. Consider the lilies a the goddamn field, or-hell!- take a look at Delmar here as your paradigm a hope.
